newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Capetronic stock debuts at 12.80 rgt.
newsitem.headline: Capetronic stock debuts at 12.80 rgt.

text.p: The stock of Malaysian audio systems maker Capetronic Consumer Electronics Holdings Ltd made its market debut at 12.80 ringgit against an offer price of 7.80 ringgit.
The company offered four million vendor shares and issued six million new shares for its listing on the Second Board of the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange.
The company forecast net profit of 26.75 million ringgit for the year ended December 31, 1997, or net earnings per share (EPS) of 67.6 cents on an enlarged share capital.
This compared with net profit of 25.05 million ringgit in the previous year, with net EPS of 74 cents and on turnover of 379.39 million ringgit.
Around five minutes into the opening, the stock was at 13.70 ringgit, having traded between 12.80 and 14.00 ringgit on volume of 724,000 shares.
